questions.Question: The headquarters of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is located in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Board of Control for Cricket in India was formed in December 1928 as a society, registered under the Tamil Nadu Societies Registration Act. It is a consortium of state cricket associations and the state associations select their representatives who in turn elect the BCCI Chief. Its headquarters are in Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.

questions.Question: India became a member in 2016 -
questions.solution: Solution:		India formally applied for membership to the Missile Technology Control Regime in June 2015, with active support from Russia, France and the United States, and officially became a member on 27 June 2016 with the consensus of the 34 member nations.

questions.Question: The Seventeenth conference of NAM was held at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Seventeenth conference of NAM was held at Porlamar.

questions.Question: Which one of the following cities hosted the Tenth Ministerial Conference of World Trade Organization during December 2015?
questions.solution: Solution:		The WTO's 10th Ministerial Conference was held in Nairobi, Kenya, from 15 to 19 December 2015.

questions.Question: Which of the country is not a member of SAARC?
questions.solution: Solution:		All the members of the SAARC are : Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Nepal, Maldives, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

questions.Question: The Economic and Social Commission for Asia and Pacific (ESCAP) is located at -
questions.solution: Solution:		Established in 1947 with its headquarters in Bangkok, Thailand, The Economic and Social Commission for Asia and Pacific (ESCAP) serves as the highest intergovernmental regional platform to promote cooperation among member States for creating a more interconnected region working to achieve inclusive and sustainable economic and social development.

questions.Question: Vietnam joined the UN in the year -
questions.solution: Solution:		Vietnam became a UN member in 1977.

questions.Question: The International Court of Justice is located at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Court of Justice, also known as the World Court, is the main judicial organ of the UN. It was established in June 1945 by the Charter of the United Nations and began work in April 1946. The seat of the Court is at the Peace Palace in The Hague (Netherlands).

questions.Question: Which of the following international organisations has started the scheme 'Partnership for Peace' for a group of nations?
questions.optionB: Economic and Social Commission for Asia and Pacific (ESCAP)
questions.solution: Solution:		NATO constitutes 28 member states across North America and Europe. The Partnership for Peace (PfP) is a programme of practical bilateral cooperation between individual Euro - Atlantic partner countries and NATO.

questions.Question: Which of the following pairs of country and the purpose for which UN Peace Keeping Force is maintained is correctly matched?
questions.optionA: Cyprus - to maintain peace between the two dominant ethnic groups in the country
questions.optionC: El Salvador - to deliver humanitarian aid
questions.solution: Solution:		Cyprus - to maintain peace between the two dominant ethnic groups in the country.

questions.Question: In the UN, how many territories were placed under the trusteeship system?
questions.solution: Solution:		In the early years of the United Nations, 11 Territories were placed under the International Trusteeship System. All 11 Territories have either become independent States or have voluntarily joined neighbouring independent countries.

questions.Question: How many members are their in the G-20 group?
questions.solution: Solution:		As of 2020 there are 20 members of the group : Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, the European Union, France, Germany, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, South Korea, Turkey, United Kingdom, and United States.

questions.Question: How many member countries were founder of the Southern African Development Community?
questions.solution: Solution:		Southern African Development Community (SADC) was established in April 1980 by governments of the nine Southern African countries of Angola, Botswana, Lesotho, Malawi, Mozambique, Swaziland, Tanzania, Zambia and Zimbabwe.

questions.Question: How many organs are there in UNO?
questions.solution: Solution:		The United Nations Organisation (UNO) has six main organs.

questions.Question: Original member states in Bank of Central African States -
questions.solution: Solution:		The five original members in Bank of Central African States are Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Republic of the Congo and Gabon.

questions.Question: The Indian Institute of Remote sensing is located at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Indian Institute of Remote sensing is located at Dehradun.

questions.Question: The latest addition to the list of UNESCO's world heritage sites in India among the following is -
questions.solution: Solution:		The latest addition to the list of UNESCO's world heritage sites in India among the following is Red Fort.

questions.Question: Official language of Bank of Central African States -
questions.solution: Solution:		Official language of Bank of Central African States is French.

questions.Question: National Institute of Nutrition is a institute located in the State of :
questions.solution: Solution:		National Institute of Nutrition is a institute located in the State of Telangana.

questions.Question: P-5 is a group of -
questions.optionC: permanent members of the Security Council
questions.solution: Solution:		The Security Council has five permanent members - China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States - collectively known as the P-5.

questions.Question: SAARC is observing a decade (1991 - 2000) of which of the following?
questions.solution: Solution:		SAARC is observing a decade (1991 - 2000) of girl child.

questions.Question: The headquarters of Food and Agriculture Organisation is in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Food and Agriculture Organisation headquarters is located in the city centre of Rome, near the Circo Massimo and close to the Colosseum.

questions.Question: Which of the following countries is not a member of Group 15 developing countries?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bolivia is not a member of Group 15 developing countries.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is not related to disarmament?
questions.solution: Solution:		NATO stands for The North Atlantic Treaty Organisation. It was established in the year 1949. Its headquarter is located in Brussels, Belgium. Unlike NPT, SALT, and CTBT, NATO is not related to disarmament.

questions.Question: Which of the following describe correctly the Group of Seven Countries (G-7)?
questions.optionC: They are holding Atomic Bomb technology.
questions.optionD: They are countries who can launch their own satellites.
questions.solution: Solution:		The Group of seven is a group consisting of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States. These countries, with the 7 largest advanced economies in the world, represent more than 62% of the global net wealth. They are industrialised economies.

questions.Question: The headquarters of UNHCR is located at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) is a UN agency mandated to aid and protect refugees, forcibly displaced communities, and stateless people, and to assist in their voluntary repatriation, local integration or resettlement to a third country. It is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, with over 17300 staff working in 135 countries.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a military alliance?
questions.solution: Solution:		The North Atlantic Treaty Organization was created in 1949 by the United States, Canada, and several Western European nations to provide collective security against the Soviet Union. NATO was the first peacetime military alliance the United States entered into outside of the Western Hemisphere.

questions.Question: The headquarters of International Labour Organisation is at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Labour Organisation is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.Question: The UNO was founded at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The UNO was founded on 24 October 1945, San Francisco, California, United States.

questions.Question: The first General Secretary of UNO was -
questions.solution: Solution:		Trygve Lie, in full Trygve Halvdan Lie was a Norwegian politician and diplomat, the first secretary of the United Nations (1946–52), who resigned largely because of the Soviet Union's resentment of his support of UN military intervention in the Korean War.

questions.Question: Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN) is a group of 10 South Asian nations which came into existence after . . . . . . . . . declaration.
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The headquarters of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), formed out of erst while USSR, is at :
questions.solution: Solution:		The Commonwealth of Independent States has its headquarters at Minsk, Belarus.

questions.Question: Who is 195th member of UNESCO?
questions.solution: Solution:		After completing procedures for the ratification UNESCO's Constitution on 23 November 2011, Palestine entry as a Member State brought the number of UNESCO's Member States to 195.

questions.Question: National Dairy Research Institute is located at :
questions.solution: Solution:		The National Dairy Research Institute (NDRI), located in Karnal (Haryana) is a premier research organisation under the aegis of Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).

questions.Question: In January 2018, 'Friends of MP Conclave' was held in which city?
questions.solution: Solution:		Government of Madhya Pradesh organised 'Friends of Madhya Pradesh Conclave', at Hotel Marriott, Indore from 3rd to 4th January 2018.

questions.Question: The World Trade Organization (WTO) came into effect in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The World Trade Organization came into being in 1995. One of the youngest of the international organizations, the WTO is the successor to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) established in the wake of the Second World War.

questions.Question: WTO came into existence in the year -
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: When did Economic Community of Central African States came into existence?
questions.solution: Solution:		Economic Community of Central African States (ECCAS) was established on 18 October 1983.

questions.Question: When was Niger Basin Authority established?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1980, the Niger Basin Authority was created with the mandate of speeding up interstate cooperation in the development of the basin resources.

questions.Question: When was the Montreal protocol assigned to reduce production of Chlorofluorocarbons?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer (the Montreal Protocol) is an international agreement made in 1987.

questions.Question: The headquarters of Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries is located in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The OPEC Secretariat is the executive organ of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC). Located in Vienna, it also functions as the headquarters of the organization.

questions.Question: Doctors Without Borders (Medecins Sans Frontiers), often in the news, is
questions.optionA: A division of World Health Organization
questions.optionC: An inter - governmental agency sponsored by European Union
questions.optionD: A specialized agency of the United Nations
questions.solution: Solution:		Medecins Sans Frontiers sometimes rendered in English as Doctors Without Borders, is an international humanitarian medical non - governmental organisation (NGO) of French origin best known for its projects in conflict zones and in countries affected by endemic diseases.

questions.Question: Tuvalu has become a point of discussion. Why?
questions.optionA: New innovative technology to meet global warming.
questions.optionB: A country under threat of submergence due to ice melting and sea level rise.
questions.optionC: Potato plant that could grow in high altitude.
questions.optionD: Place in equatorial Africa, where snow is found.
questions.solution: Solution:		Tuvalu is the world's fourth smallest country, the archipelago of six coral atolls and three islands covers an area of just 26 km2. The existence of the low - lying islands is threatened by rising sea levels caused by global warming.

questions.Question: When did World Health Organization (WHO) come into force?
questions.solution: Solution:		WHO's Constitution came into force on 7 April 1948.

questions.Question: When and where was the summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korea leader Kim Jong-un held?
questions.solution: Solution:		The summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korea leader Kim Jong-Un was held in Singapore on 12 June 2018.

questions.Question: On 22nd March 2018 who unveiled the book, Neel Ke Dhabbe on the occasion of 106th Bihar Day in Patna?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Vice President of India Shri Venkaiah Naidu unveiled the book, Neel Ke Dhabbe on the occasion of 106th Bihar Day in Patna on 22nd March 2018.

questions.Question: Which is the official language of Southern African Development Community :
questions.solution: Solution:		The Southern African Development Community operates a trilingual policy that recognises English, French and Portuguese as its official languages.

questions.Question: Which one of the following countries held 11th World Hindi Conference in August 2018?
questions.optionB: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago
questions.solution: Solution:		The 11th World Hindi Conference (WHC) is being organized from 18 - 20 August 2018 in Mauritius by the Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India in association with the Government of Mauritius.

questions.Question: The office of the UN General Assembly is in :
questions.solution: Solution:		The General debate is held in the General Assembly Hall at the United Nations headquarters in New York.

questions.Question: Where is the headquarters of WTO?
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of WTO is in Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.Question: The year 1995 is the Golden Jubilee year of which of the following international organisations?
questions.solution: Solution:		The year 1995 is the Golden Jubilee year of United Nations Organisation (UNO).

questions.Question: The United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) is located at which of the following places?
questions.solution: Solution:		United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) headquarters are located in Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.Question: Amnesty International is an organisation associated with which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		Amnesty International (AI), international nongovernmental organization (NGO) founded in London on 28 May 1961, that seeks to publicize violations by governments and other entities of rights recognized in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948), especially freedom of speech and of conscience and the right against torture.

questions.Question: The Halifax summit was that of -
questions.optionC: Countries in favour of a common currency for Europe
questions.solution: Solution:		The 21st G7 summit was held on June 15 - 17, 1995 in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada.

questions.Question: The office of the UN General Assembly is in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The General debate is held in the General Assembly Hall at the United Nations headquarters in New York.

questions.Question: India was elected as a President of General Assembly of the United Nations in 1953. Who occupied the office on behalf of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1953, the chief delegate of India at the time, Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit was elected the first woman President of the UN General Assembly.

questions.Question: United Nations adapted a Charter of Economic Rights in the year -
questions.solution: Solution:		The General Assembly adopted "Charter of Economic Rights and Duties of States" on 12 December 1974.

questions.Question: Which organ of the United Nations has ceased to be operational?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The United Nations is considered as a universal organisation. Which organ of the united nations fully represents the fact?
questions.solution: Solution:		All 193 Member States of the UN are represented in the General Assembly, making it the only UN body with universal representation.

questions.Question: The headquarters of the International Tropical Timber Organization is located at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of the International Tropical Timber Organization is located in Yokohama, Japan.

questions.Question: In October 2014, India has been re-elected for three years as a member to -
questions.optionC: The UN Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC)
questions.solution: Solution:		In October 2014, India was re-elected for three years as a member to UN Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC).

questions.Question: Which one among the following statements about United Nations organs is correct?
questions.optionA: Decisions of the General Assembly are blinding on all members.
questions.optionB: The term of the non-permanent members of the Security Council is for three years.
questions.optionC: International Court of Justice has 20 Judges elected for a period of five years.
questions.optionD: The Trusteeship Council has been suspended since 1 November 1994.
questions.solution: Solution:		The Trusteeship Council suspended its operations on 1 November 1994, a month after the independence of Palau, the last remaining United Nations trust territory.

questions.Question: Which institute has been awarded the 2018 National Intellectual Property Award in the category Top R & D Institution/Organization for Patents and Commercialization?
questions.optionA: The Council of Scientific and Industrial Research
questions.optionD: The Defence Research and Development Organisation
questions.solution: Solution:		The Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) was awarded the National Intellectual Property (IP) Award 2018 in the category 'Top R&D Institution/Organisation for Patents and Commercialisation'.

questions.Question: The headquarter of the International Court of Justice is at :
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarter of the International Court of Justice is at Hague.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not true for SAFTA (South Asian Free Trade Area)?
questions.optionA: It is a step towards a South Asian customs union and common market.
questions.optionB: The agreement came into effect in 2006.
questions.optionC: The SAFTA is a trade liberalisation regime.
questions.optionD: The SAFTA agreement takes precedence over any other agreement a member country may have with states outside SAFT
questions.solution: Solution:		"The SAFTA agreement takes precedence over any other agreement a member country may have with states outside SAFTA" is an incorrect statement.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is not a member of MERCOSUR (Southern Common Market)?
questions.solution: Solution:		MERCOSUR (Southern Common Market) full - time members are Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, and Uruguay.

questions.Question: Where is the headquarters of Pan American Health Organization?
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of Pan American Health Organization is in Washington DC, United States.

questions.Question: Which is not a Bretton Woods Institution?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Bretton Woods Institutions are the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

questions.Question: When was West African Development Bank formed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The West African Development Bank (BOAD) is the common development finance institution of the member countries of the West African Monetary Union (WAMU). It was established by an Agreement signed on 14 November 1973, and became operational in 1976.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the full form of NATO?
questions.solution: Solution:		NATO stands for North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

questions.Question: The oldest mutual fund in India is the -
questions.solution: Solution:		Among 45 odd mutual fund house in India, UTI Asset Management Company Ltd. (UTI AMC) is one of the oldest and most reputed names.

questions.Question: 19th SAARC Summit was planned to be held in November 2016 but it got postponed. Which country was its host?
questions.solution: Solution:		Pakistan was the host of 19th SAARC Summit that was planned to be held in November 2016 but got postponed.

questions.Question: Which country became seventh member of SASEC on 31 March 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		Myanmar on 31 March 2017 became the seventh member of the South Asia Sub - regional Economic Cooperation (SASEC) Program.

questions.Question: Where was the 14th Asia Security Summit (Shangri - La Dialogue) held in May 2015?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 14th Asia - Pacific Security Summit, also known as the IISS Shangri - La Dialogue, will be held in Singapore from 29 - 31 May 2015.

questions.Question: Which is the official language of Central Bank of West African Bank?
questions.solution: Solution:		The official language of Central Bank of West African Bank is Arabic.

questions.Question: Security Council of the UN comprises of 10 non - permanent members and their tenure is . . . . . . . . . .
questions.solution: Solution:		The ten elected or non - permanent members have a tenure of two years.

questions.Question:
Consider the following countries:
1. Australia
2. Canada
3. China
4. India
5. Japan
6. USA
Which of the above are among the 'free - trade partners' of ASEAN?
questions.solution: Solution:		ASEAN has five free trade agreements (FTAs) with six Dialogue Partners, namely China, Japan, Republic of Korea, India, Australia and New Zealand.

questions.Question: When was Lake Chad Basin Commission founded :
questions.solution: Solution:		Lake Chad Basin Commission was founded on 22nd May 1964.

questions.Question:
Consider the following statements regarding Indian Ocean Rim Association :
1. The 13th Council of Ministers Meeting of the Association was held in November 2013 in Perth.
2. India was elected Chair of the Association from 2013 to 2015.
3. There are twenty member nations in the Association.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		All the statements about Indian Ocean Rim Association are correct.

questions.Question:
Consider the following statements :
1. New Development Bank has been set up by APEC.
2. The headquarters of New Development Bank is in Shanghai.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The New Development Bank (NDB), formerly referred to as the BRICS Development Bank, is a multilateral development bank established by the BRICS states (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa).

questions.Question: The WTO came into being on -
questions.solution: Solution:		The WTO began life on 1st January 1995, but its trading system is half a century older.

questions.Question:
Which of the following are UNESCO recognized world heritage sites?
1. Caves of Ajanta
2. Temples and caves at Ellora
3. Mandapas of Mahabalipuram
4. Caves of Kanheri
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
questions.solution: Solution:		Caves of Kanheri is not in the list of UNESCO recognized world heritage sites.

questions.Question:
Consider the following statements about IAEA -
1. It was set up as the world's Atoms for Peace organization in 1957.
2. The IAEA Secretariat is headquartered at the Vienna International Centre in Vienna, Austria.
3. In terms of its Statue, the IAEA reports annually to the UN General Assembly.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Atomic Energy Agency is an international organization that seeks to promote the peaceful use of nuclear energy, and to inhibit its use for any military purpose, including nuclear weapons. The IAEA was established as an autonomous organisation on 29 July 1957.

questions.Question:
The 3rd meeting of the SAARC Culture Ministers, convened in New Delhi on 25 September 2014, unanimously resolved.
1. To declare 2015 - 16 as the SAARC year of Cultural Heritage.
2. That Bamiyan will be the SAARC cultural capital for 2015 - 16.
3. To promote SAARC culture online by launching a dedicated SAARC website on culture, with emphasis on digitization of rare manuscripts, rare books and other articles of intangible cultural value.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
questions.solution: Solution:		The SAARC Culture Ministers appraised the meeting on national initiatives on conservation, preservation and promotion of cultural heritage, commended the work done by the SAARC Cultural Centre in Colombo in implementation of the SAARC agenda for culture and recognising the financing requirements of cultural development programs, proposed a joint meeting of SAARC Culture Ministers with SAARC Ministers of Finance.

questions.Question:
Which of the following nations were recently suspended with regard to the voting rights by the UNESCO for not paying their dues to it?
1. United States of America
2. Israel
3. Iran
4. Iraq
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
questions.solution: Solution:		Two years after they stopped paying their dues to UNESCO, the United States and Israel lost UNESCO voting rights.

questions.Question: When did the UN General Assembly establish UN Industrial Development Organization?
questions.solution: Solution:		On 17 November 1966, the UN General Assembly passes Resolution 2152 establishing the UN Industrial Development Organization as an autonomous body within the United Nations. Its mission was to promote and accelerate the industrialization of developing countries.

questions.Question: When was Central Bank of West African States formed?
questions.solution: Solution:		Central Bank of West African States was formed on 12 May 1962.

questions.Question: The Atomic Energy Commission was set up in :
questions.solution: Solution:		The Indian Atomic Energy Commission was first setup in August 1948 in the Department of Scientific Research, which was created a few months earlier in June 1948.

questions.Question: In which year United Nations Organization was formed?
questions.solution: Solution:		United Nations Organization was formed on 24 October 1945, San Francisco, California, United States.

questions.Question: The International Court of Justice was established in the year :
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Court of Justice, also known as the World Court, is the main judicial organ of the UN. It was established in June 1945 by the Charter of the United Nations and began work in April 1946.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not associated with the UNO?
questions.solution: Solution:		UNO: United Nations OrganizationILO: International Labour Organization

questions.Question: The chairmanship/presidency of the UN Security Council rotates among the Council Members -
questions.solution: Solution:		 The presidency of the United Nations Security Council rotates on a monthly basis alphabetically among all of the members based on their English name.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a chief organ of the United Nations Organisation?
questions.solution: Solution:		The main organs of the United Nations Organisation are the General Assembly, the Security Council, the Economic and Social Council, the Trusteeship Council, the International Court of Justice, and the UN Secretariat.

questions.Question: Permanent Secretariat to coordinate the implementation of SAARC programme is located at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The SAARC was founded in Dhaka on 8 December 1985. Its secretariat is based in Kathmandu, Nepal. The organization promotes development of economic and regional integration.

questions.Question: The Indian delegation to the first World Conference on Human Rights was led by -
questions.solution: Solution:		Dr. Manmohan Singh is the first Indian delegation that attended the first World Conference. The whole conference was on Human Rights.

questions.Question: Which is the official language of West African Development Bank?
questions.solution: Solution:		The official language of West African Development Bank is French.

questions.Question: In October 2018, India was elected as a member to the United Nations Human Rights Council for a period of -
questions.solution: Solution:		India was elected to the United Nations top human rights body for a period of three years beginning 1 January, 2019.

questions.Question: On 2nd June 2015 a Conference on Make in India Indigenisation of currency was organised by the department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, Government of India. Who inaugurated the Conference?
questions.solution: Solution:		Finance Minister Arun Jaitley inaugurated the conference on 'Make in India - Indigenization of Currency' in New Delhi. He underlined the need for indigenization of paper, ink and security features of Indian currency. In this context, he mentioned the beginning of commercial production of higher denomination of bank note paper at SPM, Hoshangabad.

questions.Question: The 2 + 2 Bilateral Dialogue was held in September 2018 between -
questions.optionA: External Affairs and Defence Ministers of India with their US counterparts
questions.optionB: Finance and Defence Ministers of India with their Russian counterparts
questions.optionC: Home and Defence Ministers of India and their counterparts in Pakistan
questions.optionD: External Affairs and Defence Ministers of India with their counterparts in Pakistan
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: BRICS leaders signed the agreement to establish a New Development Bank at the summit held in :
questions.solution: Solution:		Agreement on the New Development Bank was signed during 6th BRICS Summit held in Fortaleza, Brazil (2014).

questions.Question: Which of the following is the implementing ministry of Jeevan Jyoti Beema Yojana of Government of India?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The SAARC Secretariat is located at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The SAARC Secretariat is based in Kathmandu, Nepal.

questions.Question: The five permanent members of the UN security council are -
questions.optionA: USA, China, France, Russia and Canada
questions.optionB: China, France, Russia, UK and USA
questions.optionC: Japan, Germany, Russia, UK and USA
questions.optionD: Germany, China, USA, Russia and UK
questions.solution: Solution:		The five permanent members of the UN security council are China, France, Russia, UK and USA.

questions.Question: Which one of the following statements is not correct in respect of the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC)?
questions.optionA: Its headquarters is located in Kathmandu.
questions.optionB: China is the only country with an observer status in SAAR
questions.optionD: The first SAARC Summit was held in Dhaka.
questions.solution: Solution:		"China is the only country with an observer status in SAARC" is an incorrect statement.

questions.Question: BRICS Summit 2016 was held in -
questions.solution: Solution:		BRICS Summit 2016 was held from 15 to 16 October 2016 at the Taj Exotica hotel in Benaulim, Goa, India.

questions.Question: G-15 is a group of -
questions.solution: Solution:		The G-15, a group of 17 developing countries from Asia, Africa and Latin America, was set up to foster cooperation and provide input for other international groups, such as the World Trade Organization and the Group of Seven rich industrialized nations. The G-15 focuses on cooperation among developing countries in the areas of investment, trade, and technology. The membership of the G-15 has expanded to 18 countries, but the name has remained unchanged.

questions.Question: The Indian Red Cross Society was established in the year -
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Red Cross Society (IRCS) was established in 1920 under the Indian Red Cross Society Act. The act was last amended in 1992 and of rules were formed in 1994.

questions.Question: SAARC was founded in -
questions.solution: Solution:		SAARC was founded in Dhaka, Bangladesh.

questions.Question: Which organ of United Nations has ceased to be operational?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Trusteeship Council suspended its operations on 1 November 1994, a month after the independence of Palau, the last remaining United Nations trust territory.

questions.Question: The member countries of NAFTA are -
questions.solution: Solution:		The member countries of NAFTA are USA, Canada and Mexico.

questions.Question: Which is principal organ of the United Nations that as virtually accomplished its object?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The headquarters of the UNESCO is at -
questions.solution: Solution:		UNESCO has 195 Members and 8 Associate Members and is governed by the General Conference and the Executive Board. The Organization has more than50 field offices around the world and its headquarters are located in Paris.

questions.Question: Which UN body deals with population problem?
questions.solution: Solution:		UNFPA is a subsidiary organ of the United Nations General Assembly. It plays a unique role within the United Nations system: to address population and development issues, with an emphasis on reproductive health and gender equality.

questions.Question: Besides UK, USA, Germany and Japan the G-7 countries includes -
questions.solution: Solution:		G-7 countries consist of the US, UK, France, Germany, Italy, Canada, and Japan.

questions.Question: The headquarters of World Intellectual Property Organisation (WIPO) is located in -
questions.solution: Solution:		WIPO is a intergovernmental organization, with its headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.Question: Match the United Nations Agency with its headquarters and find the incorrect match?
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of Food and Agriculture Organization is in Italy, Rome.

questions.Question: The International Human Rights Convention adopted by the United Nations in 1990 relates to -
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of their Families (ICMW) is a comprehensive international human rights mechanism adopted by the United Nations in 1990 with the purpose of protecting the migrant workers and members of their families.

questions.Question: Who was the first Indian to be President of UN General Assembly?
questions.solution: Solution:		Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit (18 August 1900 - 1 December 1990) was an Indian diplomat and politician who was the first female elected to 6th Governor of Maharashtra and 8th President of the United Nations General Assembly.

questions.Question: How many former republics of USSR have become members of the Commonwealth of Independent States?
questions.solution: Solution:		Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), free association of sovereign states that was formed in 1991 by Russia and 11 other republics that were formerly part of the Soviet Union.

questions.Question: The five permanent members of UN security council are
questions.optionA: Japan, West Germany, USSR, UK and USA
questions.optionB: Canada, China, France, USSR and USA
questions.optionC: Germany, China, USSR, UK and USA
questions.optionD: China, France, USSR, UK and USA
questions.solution: Solution:		The permanent members of the United Nations Security Council (also known as the Permanent Five, Big Five, or P5) are the five sovereign states to whom the UN Charter of 1945 grants a permanent seat on the UN Security Council: China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

questions.Question: When was the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) formed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) was formed on 8 December 1985.

questions.Question: In which year 'Human Rights Resolution' was adopted by the UN?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Which Article of the UN Charter established the International Trusteeship System?
questions.solution: Solution:		Article 75 The United Nations shall establish under its authority an international trusteeship system for the administration and supervision of such territories as may be placed thereunder by subsequent individual agreements. These territories are hereinafter referred to as trust territories.

questions.Question: How many member countries are there in the Executive Board of UNESCO?
questions.solution: Solution:		Executive Board of UNESCO consists of 58 Member States each with a four - year term of office.

questions.Question: How many countries are represented in Unrepresented Nations and Peoples Organisation?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: How many non - regional members are there in the African Development Bank?
questions.solution: Solution:		There are 26 non - regional members in the African Development Bank.

questions.Question: The latest official language of the UN is :
questions.solution: Solution:		The latest official language of the UN is Arabic.

questions.Question: In the group of countries known as BRICS, S stands for :

questions.Question: The headquarters of which one of the following organizations is not in Geneva?
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of Food and Agriculture Organisation is in Rome, Italy.

questions.Question: Where is the headquarters of the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP)?
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is in Nairobi, Kenya.

questions.solution: Solution:		 The venue of the 2nd BRICS Youth Summit of the Ministers, Officials and Youth Delegations was Guwahati, Assam.

questions.Question: In which one of the following places is the Forest Survey of India (FSI), a national organization engaged in forest cover mapping, forest inventory and training in the field of remote sensing and GIS, located?
questions.solution: Solution:		Government of India conducts survey and assessment of forest resources in the country. The organization came into being in June 1981. The headquarters of Forest Survey of India (FSI) are at Dehradun.

questions.Question: Which one of the following statements about the Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU - GKY) is not correct?
questions.optionA: It is a placement - linked skill training programme exclusively for rural girls.
questions.optionB: It aims to convert India's demographic surplus into a demographic dividend.

questions.solution: Solution:		"It is a placement - linked skill training programme exclusively for rural girls" is an incorrect statement.

questions.Question: The term "Two - State Solution" is sometimes mentioned in the news in the context of the affairs of -
questions.solution: Solution:		The "Two - State Solution" is used in the context of the Israel Palestine issue. It envisages an independent State of Palestine alongside the State of Israel west of the Jordan River.

questions.Question: Where was the 14th ASEAN - India summit organized?
questions.solution: Solution:		14th ASEAN - India Summit and 11th East Asia Summit was organized in Vientiane.

questions.Question: United Nations General Assembly declared the year 2013 as -
questions.optionD: International Year of Science and Technology Cooperation
questions.solution: Solution:		On 11 February 2011, the UN General Assembly, decided to proclaim 2013 International Year of Water Cooperation.

questions.Question: The International Court of Justice is located at :
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Court of Justice, also known as the World Court, is the main judicial organ of the UN. It was established in June 1945 by the Charter of the United Nations and began work in April 1946. The seat of the Court is at the Peace Palace in the Hague (Netherlands).

questions.Question: With which nation, India has signed an agreement 'Mobilize Your City' in September 2018?
questions.solution: Solution:		India and France signed implementation agreement on 'Mobilize Your City'.

questions.Question: Which one country is not a permanent member of the Security Council of the United Nations?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Security Council has five permanent members - China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

questions.Question: Who among the following is not a member of G-7?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Group of Seven (G-7) is an inter - governmental political forum consisting of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States.

questions.Question: Where is the head - office of the World Council of Churches?
questions.solution: Solution:		The head - office of the World Council of Churches is in Switzerland.

questions.Question: Which state organised India's first Tribal Entrepreneurship Summit in November 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		India's first Tribal Entrepreneurship Summit began in Dantewada, a district in the Bastar region of Chhattisgarh on 14 November 2017.

questions.Question: Where was the fifth BRICS Summit hosted by South Africa in March 2013?
questions.solution: Solution:		South Africa hosted the fifth BRICS Summit from 26 to 27 March 2013 at the Durban International Convention Centre.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not associated with NAFTA?
questions.solution: Solution:		The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is an agreement or treaty signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, affective from 1 Jan 1994 for free trade between members.

questions.Question: India is not a member of which of the following organization?
questions.solution: Solution:		India is not a member of NATO.

questions.Question: Which of the following are members of BRICS?

questions.optionB: Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa
questions.optionC: Brazil, Russia, Indonesia, China and Singapore

questions.solution: Solution:		Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa are members of BRICS.

questions.Question: The 2015 G-20 Summit was held at -
questions.solution: Solution:		The 2015 G-20 Antalya summit was the tenth annual meeting of the G-20 heads of government/heads of state. It was held in Belek, Antalya Province, Turkey on 15 - 16 November 2015.

questions.Question: Where is the Central Food Technology Research Institute situated?
questions.solution: Solution:		Central Food Technology Research Institute is situated in Mysore.

questions.Question: On 8 March 2013 President of India has released commemorative postage stamp on late Sahir Ludhianvi at Rashtrapati Bhawan, Ludhianvi was :

questions.optionB: an eminent social activist of India
questions.optionC: one of the top Urdu dramatists and actor

questions.solution: Solution:		On 8 March 2013 President of India has released commemorative postage stamp on late Sahir Ludhianvi at Rashtrapati Bhawan, Ludhianvi was widely acclaimed as a people's poet.

questions.Question: Which among the following is not a human rights group?
questions.solution: Solution:		Greenpeace uses non-violent creative action to pave the way towards a greener, more peaceful world, and to confront the systems that threaten our environment.

questions.Question: Indian Development Forum (IDF) was earlier known as :
questions.solution: Solution:		The Aid - India Consortium was organized in 1958 as an international scheme to support the economic development of India, and led by the World Bank. This later came to be known as the Indian Development Forum.

questions.Question:
Consider the following statements :
The India - Africa Summit
1. Held in 2015 was the third such Summit.
2. Was actually initiated by Jawaharlal Nehru in 1951.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first India - Africa Summit was held from 4 April to 8 April 2008 in New Delhi, India.

questions.Question:

1. The First Summit of BRICS was held in Rio de Janeiro in 2009.
2. South Africa was the last to join the BRICS grouping.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The First Summit of BRICS was held in Russia. So, statement 1 is false.

questions.Question:
With reference to 'Asia Pacific Ministerial Conference on Housing and Urban Development (APMCHUD)' consider the following statements :
1. The first APMCHUD was held in India in 2006 on the theme 'Emerging Urban Forms - Policy Responses and Governance Structure'.
2. India hosts all the Annual Ministerial Conferences in partnership with ADB, APEC and ASEAN.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Asia Pacific Ministerial Conference on Housing and Urban Development (APMCHUD) was established in 2006 to promote sustainable housing and urban development for human settlements in the Asia - Pacific Region.

questions.Question:
With reference to the 'Trans - Pacific Partnership', consider the following statements:
1. It is an agreement among all the Pacific Rim countries except China and Russia.
2. It is a strategic alliance for the purpose of maritime security only.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Trans - Pacific Partnership (TPP), or Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement, was a proposed trade agreement between Australia, Brunei, Canada, Chile, Japan, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Peru, Singapore, Vietnam, and the United States signed on 4 February 2016.

questions.Question:
With reference to 'Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)', consider the following statements :
1. It is an organization of European Union in working relation with NATO and WHO.
2. It monitors chemical industry to prevent new weapons from emerging.
3. It provides assistance and protection to States (Parties) against chemical weapons threats.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		As the implementing body for the Chemical Weapons Convention, the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons, with its 193 Member States, oversees the global endeavour to permanently and verifiably eliminate chemical weapons.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the headquarters of World Trade Organisation (WTO)?
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of World Trade Organisation (WTO) is located at Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.Question: The international township built near Pondicherry in India in coloration with UNESCO is called -

questions.Question: Which of the following countries is not a member of G-15?

questions.solution: Solution:		Pakistan which rejoined the Commonwealth, had pulled itself out of it in the year 1972.

questions.Question: Which of the following countries is not a member of SAARC?
questions.solution: Solution:The South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) is an organization of South Asian nations, which was established on 8 December 1985 when the government of Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka formally adopted its charter providing for the promotion of economic and social progress, cultural development within the South Asia region and also for friendship and cooperation with other developing countries. It has its headquarters in Kathmandu, Nepal. It has total 8 member countries.

questions.Question: The main aim of SAARC is -
questions.solution: Solution:		SAARC aims to promote economic growth, social progress and cultural development within the South Asia region. The objectives of SAARC, as defined in its charter, are as follows : Promote the welfare of the peoples of South Asia and improve their quality of life.

questions.Question: The number of principal organs of UNO is -
questions.solution: Solution:		The main bodies of the United Nations are the General Assembly, the Security Council, the Economic and Social Council, the Trusteeship Council, the International Court of Justice, and the UN Secretariat.

questions.Question: G-7 includes -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Group of Seven (G-7) consists of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States.

questions.Question: INTERPOL means -
questions.solution: Solution:		INTERPOL means International Criminal Police Organisation.

questions.Question: The headquarters of UN is located in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The United Nations is headquartered in New York City in a complex designed by a board of architects led by Wallace Harrison and built by the architectural firm Harrison & Abramovitz.

questions.Question: The SAARC movement was launched for -
questions.solution: Solution:		The SAARC was founded in Dhaka on 8 December 1985. Its secretariat is based in Kathmandu, Nepal. The organization promotes development of economic and regional integration. It launched the South Asian Free Trade Area in 2006.

questions.Question: Which one of the following countries is not a member of the Nuclear Suppliers Group (NSG)?
questions.solution: Solution:		Iran is not a member of the Nuclear Suppliers Group (NSG).

questions.Question: Which one of the following nations is not a member of the Eurasian Economic Union?
questions.solution: Solution:		Eurasian Economic Union member states are Armenia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, and Russia. The correct option is D.

questions.Question: Which Indian state hosted the 3 day long 'International Yoga Fest' held from 8th to 10th March 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		Delhi hosted the 3 day long 'International Yoga Fest' held from 8th to 10th March 2017.

questions.solution: Solution:		The Punjab Lalit Kala Academy is Punjab's state academy of fine arts. It is located in Chandigarh.

questions.Question: The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) is located in :
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) was founded in 1947 and is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.solution: Solution:		The International Atomic Energy Agency Secretariat is headquartered at the Vienna International Centre in Vienna, Austria.

questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of the International Red Cross is situated in Geneva.

questions.solution: Solution:		The NAM summit which demanded expansion of the United Nations Security council had met at Jakarta.

questions.solution: Solution:		The South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) is the regional intergovernmental organization and geopolitical union of nations in South Asia. Its members include Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Nepal, Maldives, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

questions.Question: Where was the first ever Security Council Summit meeting held in early 1992?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 1992 United Nations Security Council election was held on 27 October 1992 during the Forty - seventh session of the United Nations General Assembly, held at United Nations Headquarters in New York City.

questions.Question: Which of the following country is not a member of G-7?
questions.solution: Solution:		Russia is not a member of G-7.

questions.Question: When was Bank of Central African States formed?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The Nuclear Non - Proliferation Treaty came into force in -
questions.solution: Solution:		Opened for signature in 1968, the Nuclear Non - Proliferation Treaty entered into force in 1970. On 11 May 1995, the Treaty was extended indefinitely. A total of 191 States have joined the Treaty, including the five nuclear - weapon States.

questions.Question: In which year was the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) founded?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) was founded on 15 August 1969.

questions.Question: In which year, UN General Assembly terminated South Africa's mandate over Namibia?
questions.solution: Solution:		On 27 October 1966, the UN General Assembly terminated South Africa's mandate over Namibia, and declared the territory to be the direct responsibility of the UN.

1. Preferential Rules of Origin for Least - Developed Countries.
2. Operationalized of the Waiver Concerning Preferential Treatment to Services.

questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question:
Which of the following statements regarding the United Nations Peacekeeping Force is/are correct?
1. The first peacekeeping force was sent to Egypt.
2. Peacekeeping force is accountable to the Security Council.
3. First women peacekeeping force was sent by India to Liberia.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
questions.solution: Solution:		A United Nations peacekeeping mission has three power centers. The first is the Special Representative of the Secretary - General, the official leader of the mission. This person is responsible for all political and diplomatic activity, overseeing relations with both the parties to the peace treaty and the UN member - states in general. They are often a senior member of the Secretariat.

questions.Question:
Which one of the following statements about the Trans - Pacific Partnership (TPP) is/are correct?
1. The TPP was signed by 12 Pacific Rim Nations in the year 2015.
2. The TPP is likely to be a game - changer in global trade as member countries account for about 40% of global GDP.
3. India is a founder member of TPP.
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
questions.solution: Solution:		The Trans - Pacific Partnership (TPP), or Trans - Pacific Partnership Agreement, was a proposed trade agreement between Australia, Brunei, Canada, Chile, Japan, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Peru, Singapore, Vietnam, and the United States signed on 4 February 2016.

questions.Question: When was South Sudan admitted to UN as the 193rd member country of UN?
questions.solution: Solution:		South Sudan was admitted to UN as the 193rd member country of UN on 13 July 2011.

questions.Question: When was Common Market for Eastern and Southern African (COMESA) formed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa is a free trade area with twenty - one member states stretching from Tunisia to Eswatini. COMESA was formed in December 1994, replacing a Preferential Trade Area which had existed since 1981.

questions.Question: Name the committee that has been constituted by the union government to examine the existing framework with regard to virtual currencies?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Union Government constituted an Inter - Disciplinary Committee to examine the existing framework with regard to Virtual Currencies. The committee is headed by Dinesh Sharma.

questions.Question: Which one of the following cities hosted the 3rd World Trauma Congress recently?
questions.solution: Solution:		New Delhi hosted 3rd World Trauma Congress. The 3rd World Congress was a call to action to all stakeholders to end all deaths due to trauma.

questions.Question: Which country has been admitted in July 2013 as the 28th member of the European Union?
questions.solution: Solution:		On 9 December 2011 leaders from the European Union and Croatia signed the accession treaty. The country became the 28th European Union member country on 1 July 2013.

questions.Question: With which organisation has the NITI Aayog signed a Memorandum of Understanding on Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and entered into a three - year partnership?
questions.solution: Solution:		The NITI Aayog and the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) on 8 August 2018, signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and entered into a three - year partnership.

questions.Question: Which of the following event is not correctly matched with the year in which it happened?

questions.Question: How many are the non - permanent members of United Nations Security Council?

questions.Question: Which African countries are the members of the East African Development Bank :

questions.Question: The headquarters of World Trade Organisation (WTO) are located in :
questions.solution: Solution:		The headquarters of World Trade Organisation (WTO) are located in Switzerland.

questions.Question: The first summit of the Forum for India - Pacific Islands Cooperation (FIPIC) was held in :

questions.solution: Solution:		Vietnam is the new member of International Coffee Organisation.

questions.Question: Whose part is the International Bureau of Education :

questions.solution: Solution:		Angola, Malaysia, New Zealand, Spain and Venezuela were elected as non-permanent members on 16th October 2014 to serve in the UN Security Council.

questions.solution: Solution:		Pakistan is not a member of G-15.

questions.Question: Amnesty International has its headquarters at -

questions.solution: Solution:		Headquarters of the World Health Organisation is located at Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.Question: Among the SAARC countries the most densely populated country is?
questions.solution: Solution:		Among the SAARC countries, the most densely populated country is Bangladesh.

questions.Question: Which of the following parties won the most number of seats in the Punjab Legislative Election 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian National Congress won the most number of seats in the Punjab Legislative Election 2017.

questions.Question: Which of the following is an example of Cartel?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Organization of Petroleum ‐ Exporting Countries (OPEC) is perhaps the best ‐ known example of an international cartel; OPEC members meet regularly to decide how much oil each member of the cartel will be allowed to produce.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a World Bank group of five institutions?

questions.Question: One of the following is also called as World Bank -
questions.solution: Solution:		The world bank is also known as International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD).

questions.Question: The first Earth summit was held at :
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1992, more than 100 heads of state met in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil for the first international Earth Summit convened to address urgent problems of environmental protection and socio - economic development.

questions.Question: In 2017, which state government launched the 'Vision - 2025' project to seek public opinion for their dream state?

questions.Question: Electrification prior to the launch of 'Saubhagya Scheme'. Which one of the following is not among them?
questions.solution: Solution:		Eight States which have already achieved more than 99 percent household electrification prior to launch of Saubhagya scheme are ineligible for participation under the award scheme. These eight states are Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Goa, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Punjab and Tamil Nadu.

questions.Question: Amnesty International is an organization which is associated with -
questions.solution: Solution:		Amnesty International (AI), international nongovernmental organization (NGO) founded in London on 28 May 1961, that seeks to publicize violations by governments and other entities of rights recognized in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948), especially freedom of speech and of conscience and the right against torture.

questions.Question: Which mela/fair to be listed in UNESCO's list of intangible cultural heritage?
questions.solution: Solution:		According to a report released by the Ministry of External Affairs, the Kumbh Mela has been inscribed on the Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity by the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage under UNESCO.

questions.Question: India is not a member of :
questions.solution: Solution:		India is not a member of G-8.

questions.Question: The BRICS New Development Bank (NDB) has been set up for
questions.optionA: Funding Infrastructure projects in emerging economics for sustainable development
questions.optionB: Funding non - infrastructure projects in emerging economics for sustainable development
questions.optionC: Funding infrastructure projects in developed countries
questions.optionD: Funding infrastructural projects in BRICS countries only
questions.solution: Solution:		The New Development Bank (NDB), formerly referred to as the BRICS Development Bank, is a multilateral development bank established by the BRICS states (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa). According to the Agreement on the NDB, "the Bank shall support public or private projects through loans, guarantees, equity participation and other financial instruments."

questions.Question: Official language of African Development Bank -
questions.solution: Solution:		The African Development Bank multicultural status is displayed through the use of two official languages, English and French.

questions.Question: Which is the official language of the 'Common Market' for Eastern and Southern Africa?
questions.solution: Solution:		The official language of the 'Common Market' for Eastern and Southern Africa is English, French and Portuguese.

questions.Question: In April 2013, an agreement was signed between India and a country which extends the use of training and exercise facilities in India to the army of that country for a further period of five years from August, 2013. Sort out the country from among the following :
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a member of  'Gulf Cooperation Council'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Iran is not a member of 'Gulf Cooperation Council'.

questions.Question: The first BRICS Summit, after the inclusion of South Africa, was held at
questions.solution: Solution:		The first BRICS Summit, after the inclusion of South Africa, was held at Sanya.

questions.Question: In the context of which of the following do you sometimes find the terms 'amber box, blue box and green box' in the news?
questions.solution: Solution:		In WTO terminology, subsidies in general are identified by 'Boxes' which are given the colours of traffic lights : green (permitted), amber (slow down - i.e. be reduced), red (forbidden).

questions.Question: The BRICS Bank has its headquarters in?
questions.solution: Solution:		The BRICS Bank has its headquarters in Shanghai, China.
